page.title: 03BUILDINGS OF BALLINDALLOCH
page.content: There is no village or town called Ballindalloch ,but the hamlet of Marypark has 26 houses.One of them contains what is probably the smallest Post Office in Britain as its premises occupy the alcove in the hall under the stairs. Near the junction of the Avon and the Spey stands the fine and historic Ballindalloch Castle,which has been continuously occupied by the same family line since 1546. Most of the older buildings are constructed of traditional stone and lime, with slate roofs.In some cases, granite from nearby Ben Rinnes was used. A feature of the area is the number of bridges of varying styles. One is said to be of unique construction.
